comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: His coat is an example of the oiled seal skin they used to wear.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Captain Graalfs (NYTimes spelling) of the "Bavaria" gave his firsthand account of the 1914 destruction of the "Oklahoma," an oiltanker owned by Gulf Refining Company of New York City.  Thirty-two men were lost in the wreck of the Oklahoma.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT article of Jan 6, 1914 is at query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9504E7DD1730E733A...
